page.title: 03Attitudes
page.content: What is of interest here is people's attitudes to living in this part of the country. Some older residents who have spent their lives here regret the changes which they see as caused mainly by the motor car. They look back 50 - 60 years when communities were more self-contained with their own shops, schools, adequate public transport, blacksmiths who would do many repairs, and when social life revolved round the church with its large choirs. Newcomers chose this area because they want peace and quiet in beautiful surroundings, a large garden, and space to bring up a family. Many families have two cars so those who can drive are mobile and not worried by lack of public transport. Lack of entertainment is compensated for by television and the numerous societies that exist nearby.
